ovdesc.p: This file contains data and Parameter fields required for L/C processing which are not obtainable from any other File, (there is only one record) and facilitates the addition, amendment and deletion of fields on the record.
The purpose of this file is to hold static data that is standard for Letter of Credit and drawings processing, used for:
a) Input defaults (Closure Days, Currency, Market, Position Type)
b) Entries Generation (Transaction Codes and A/C Numbers)
c) End of Day Processing (Pre-Advise Days)

LC.CLASS.TYPE and EB.CLASS.NO are used to formulate the class mapping between L/C internal class and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS. The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS has lend itself to facilitate the user by automatically trigger only the message related to the operation, which user are currently do. In a sense, the system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to corresponding activity, and populate the information on the L/C transaction. Consequently, the user can take control of the class to choose whether he/she wants to produce as per suggestion by the system.
The following types are valid types:
+ BASIC.MESSAGE
+ NOTIFICATION
+ REIMBURSING
+ ADVISE.THRU
+ ADDITIONAL.MSG
+ PAYMENT.BANK
+ PAYMENT.CUST
+ COVER.BANK
+ RECEIVE.NOTIFY
+ CREDIT.CUST
+ DEBIT.CUST
+ PROVISION.CREDIT
+ PROVISION.DEBIT
+ USER.DEFINE1
+ USER.DEFINE2
+ USER.DEFINE9
+ USERDEFINE10

It is worth to note that BASIC.MESSAGE, NOTIFICATION and USER.DEFINE1 will always be triggered regardless of operations. The BASIC.MESSAGE has intentionally designed to attach the message class, which are going to send to correspondence bank, i.e. Issuing Bank, Advising Bank, Collecting Bank or Remitting Bank. The NOTIFICATION class is for the advice to Banks client, i.e. Applicant, Beneficiary, Drawer, or Drawee. And USER.DEFINE1 is an additional class for any additional message. For more detail, please consult T24 Users Guide.

Only the following values are allowed : BASIC.MESSAGE, NOTIFICATION, REIMBURSING, ADVISE.THRU, ADDITIONAL.MSG, PAYMENT.BANK, PAYMENT.CUST, COVER.BANK, RECEIVE.NOTIFY, CREDIT.CUST, DEBIT.CUST, PROVISION.CREDIT, PROVISION.DEBIT, USER.DEFINE1, USER.DEFINE2

desc.p: Defines the frequency with which interest relating to Discounted Drawings will be accrued under L/C deals in foreign currency.
The system allows the user to define different accrual frequencies for local and foreign currencies.

Input at this field specifies the frequency with which interest is to be accrued in foreign currency. The user has the choice of either daily or monthly accruals and the following examples define the various options:
(i) 12 DEC 1985 D - this input specifies that the first accrual shall be on 12th Dec 1985 and thereafter at daily (D) intervals.
(ii) 31 JAN 1985 M0131 - this input specifies that the first accrual will be on 31st Jan 1985 and thereafter at monthly (M01) intervals on the last day (31) of each month.
(iii) 31 JAN 1985 M0115 - this input specifies that the first accrual will be on 31st Jan 1985 and thereafter at monthly (M01) intervals on the fifteenth day (15) of each month.

This field identifies whether charge claim entries are to be made whereby any charges due from the beneficiary are debited from the CRF and credit to P/L, and then claimed from the Beneficiary in order to credit the CRF.

If this field is set to 'Y' then if any charges are for the account of the Beneficiary they are initially taken from the CRF 'CLM' bucket and credited to the charge P/L account. The charges are then claimed from the Beneficiary. When the Beneficiary pays the charge, this is to be entered manually on the LC/ACCOUNT.BALANCES application, so that the CRF 'CLM' bucket can be reimbursed. If the field is set to 'NO' then Beneficiary charges are not taken until a payment is made via a Drawing when the charges will be deducted from the payment amount and credited to the charge P/L account.
'Y' or 'NO'.

In an unconfirmed LETTER.OF.CREDIT the limit line in the absence of a specific LIMIT.PARAMETER, is set against the information limit line as defaulted from the LIMIT.PARAMETER.

When a LETTER.OF.CREDIT is partially confirmed, the limit line is split and one is set against the confirmed portion and the other against the unconfirmed. When this information limit line is considered redundant in a partially confirmed Letter of Credit, this may be suppressed by assigning 'NO' to this field. If set to 'YES' the information limit line appears.
For Example:
If an unconfirmed Letter of Credit is issued for GBP 100,000, the limit line would look like this:
CREDIT.LINE.NO.... 100054.0009700.01.100054 BOE:Lett Cred:BOE
This when partially confirmed for GBP 40,000, would appear in two lines:
CREDIT.LINE.NO.... 100054.0002000.01.100054 BOE:Lett Cred:BOE
CREDIT.LINE.NO.... 100054.0009700.01.100054 BOE:Lett Cred:BOE
In the above case, the second limit line is only for information purposes. This can now be suppressed by setting the value "NO" to this field.
The resultant display would be:
CREDIT.LINE.NO.... 100054.0002000.01.100054 BOE:Lett Cred:BOE
Suppression of Information limit line is done only if the Letter of Credit is partially confirmed.
Valid inputs are 'YES' or 'NO'.

The code in this field contains the Narrative used when entries have been created in the Amortisation of changes at End of Day.
3-10(Max Value) numeric characters TRANSACTION Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
The code entered must be in the range 500-599.
It must be present on TRANSACTION.CODE file, with the DEBIT.CREDIT.IND = CREDIT.
Defines the frequency at which the charges will be amortised. When the amortisation is set to monthly, user can define the day of the month on which the amortisation process will run.
Input at this field specifies the frequency with which charges are to be amortised for foreign currency charges.
(i) 31 JAN 1995 M0131 -Specifies the first amortisation as 31st Jan 1995 and thereafter at monthly (M01) intervals on the last day (31) of each month.
(ii) 31 JAN 1995 M0115 -Specifies the first amortisation as 31st Jan 1995 and thereafter at monthly (M01) intervals on the fifteenth day (15) of each month.
This field is updated to the next frequency date when the current frequency is processed.
Standard frequency format.
Can be monthly or daily frequency.
Mandatory Field.
